name: superset_mcp
description: Native Apache Superset MCP tools: list/get dashboards, charts, datasets, generate charts, and execute SQL for the fin-workspace analytics stack.

tools.name: list_dashboards
tools.description: List all Superset dashboards. Use select_columns to reduce payload.

tools.name: list_charts
tools.description: List all Superset charts. Use select_columns for lean responses.

tools.name: get_dashboard_info
tools.description: Get detailed info about a specific dashboard by ID

tools.name: get_chart_info
tools.description: Get detailed info about a specific chart by ID

tools.name: get_dataset_info
tools.description: Get detailed info about a specific dataset by ID

tools.name: generate_chart
tools.description: Generate a new chart. chart_type is MANDATORY.

tools.name: execute_sql
tools.description: Execute SQL query against a database. NOT cached - use sparingly.

notes: Resource identifiers must be numeric IDs or UUIDs; do not use names or schema.table patterns.
When calling generate_chart, chart_type is mandatory.
Use select_columns in list_* tools to reduce payload size and avoid null fields.
Caching is enabled for list_* and get_*_info tools via FastMCP 2.13.0, but NOT for execute_sql or generate_chart.
API key authentication required: Authorization: Bearer pst_...

agentInstructions:
When working with Superset analytics:
1. Use list_* tools with select_columns for discovery - this keeps responses lean.
2. Use get_*_info for detailed inspection of specific resources.
3. Resource IDs must be numeric or UUIDs - never use names.
4. For generate_chart, always specify chart_type explicitly.
5. Use execute_sql sparingly as it bypasses MCP caching.
6. Never expose API keys in logs or messages.
7. Reference Superset concepts: MCP tools, auth modes, themes, SSO, alerts & reports.
